grad¶

Module for gradients of the cost function for model parameter estimation @author Siddharth Reddy <sgr45@cornell.edu> 04/05/15

grad.get_grad(using_scipy=True, using_lessons=True, using_prereqs=True)¶

Select the appropriate gradient and cost function evaluator for a model configuration

Parameters:
  • using_scipy (bool) – Using scipy.optimize.minize for optimization
  • using_lessons (bool) – Including lessons in the embedding model
  • using_prereqs (bool) – Including lesson prereqs in the embedding model
Return type:

function
Returns:

A function that takes current parameter values as input, and outputs the gradient of the cost function with respect to those parameters
grad.with_scipy_with_prereqs(param_vals, param_shapes, assessment_interactions, lesson_interactions, learning_update_variance, forgetting_penalty_terms, regularization_constant, graph_regularization_constant, student_participation_in_assessment_ixns, student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns, assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns, curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns, assessment_participation_in_concepts, lesson_participation_in_concepts, concept_participation_in_assessments, concept_participation_in_lessons, prereq_edge_concept_idxes, concept_participation_in_prereq_edges, regularization_constants, last_student_embedding_idx, last_assessment_embedding_idx, last_lesson_embedding_idx, last_prereq_embedding_idx, last_student_bias_idx, last_assessment_bias_idx, num_timesteps, using_bias, using_graph_prior, gradient)¶

Compute the gradient of the cost function with respect to model parameters

Parameters:
  • param_vals (np.array) – Flattened, concatenated parameter values
  • tuple] param_shapes (dict[str,) – A dictionary mapping a parameter’s name to the shape of its np.ndarray
  • np.array, np.array) assessment_interactions ((np.array,) – For each assessment interaction, (student_idx, assessment_idx, outcome), where outcome is -1 or 1
  • np.array, np.array) lesson_interactions ((np.array,) – For each lesson interaction, (student_idx, lesson_idx, time_since_previous_interaction)
  • learning_update_variance (np.array|float) – Variance of the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the variance is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the variance is different for each lesson interaction.
  • forgetting_penalty_terms (np.array|float) – Penalty term for the forgetting effect in the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the penalty term is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the penalty is different for each lesson interaction.
  • float, float, float, float) regularization_constant ((float,) –
    Coefficients of the regularization terms for (students, assessments,
    lessons, prereqs, concepts)
  • graph_regularization_constant (float) – Coefficient of the graph regularization term
  • student_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep participated in the assessment interaction
  • student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student participated in the assessment interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the assessment participated in the assessment interaction
  • curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the post-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the pre-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the lesson participated in the lesson interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates assessment-concept association. Concept associations for a given assessment sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • lesson_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates lesson-concept association. Concept associations for a given lesson sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • concept_participation_in_assessments (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of assessment_participation_in_concepts
  • concept_participation_in_lessons (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of lesson_participation_in_lessons
  • np.array) prereq_edge_concept_idxes ((np.array,) – (Indices of prereq concepts, Indices of postreq concepts)
  • scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) concept_participation_in_prereq_edges ((scipy.sparse.csr_matrix,) –

    The first binary matrix has dimensions [number of unique concepts] X [number of prereq edges], where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the prereq in the edge.

    The second binary matrix has the same dimensions, where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the postreq in the edge.

  • regularization_constants (np.array) – Coefficient of regularization term for each parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last student embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_lesson_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last lesson embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_prereq_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last prereq embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last student bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • num_timesteps (int) – Maximum number of timesteps in a student history, i.e., the output of InteractionHistory.duration()
  • using_bias (bool) – Including bias terms in the assessment result likelihood
  • using_graph_prior (bool) – Including the graph regularization term
  • gradient (np.array) – Placeholder for the flattened gradient
Return type:

(float, np.array)
Returns:

The value of the cost function (evaluated at the supplied parameter values), and the flattened gradient of the cost function (evaluated at the supplied parameter values)
grad.with_scipy_without_lessons(param_vals, param_shapes, assessment_interactions, lesson_interactions, learning_update_variance, forgetting_penalty_terms, regularization_constant, graph_regularization_constant, student_participation_in_assessment_ixns, student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns, assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns, curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns, assessment_participation_in_concepts, lesson_participation_in_concepts, concept_participation_in_assessments, concept_participation_in_lessons, prereq_edge_concept_idxes, concept_participation_in_prereq_edges, regularization_constants, last_student_embedding_idx, last_assessment_embedding_idx, last_lesson_embedding_idx, last_prereq_embedding_idx, last_student_bias_idx, last_assessment_bias_idx, num_timesteps, using_bias, using_graph_prior, gradient)¶

Compute the gradient of the cost function with respect to model parameters

Parameters:
  • param_vals (np.array) – Flattened, concatenated parameter values
  • tuple] param_shapes (dict[str,) – A dictionary mapping a parameter’s name to the shape of its np.ndarray
  • np.array, np.array) assessment_interactions ((np.array,) – For each assessment interaction, (student_idx, assessment_idx, outcome), where outcome is -1 or 1
  • np.array, np.array) lesson_interactions ((np.array,) – For each lesson interaction, (student_idx, lesson_idx, time_since_previous_interaction)
  • learning_update_variance (np.array|float) – Variance of the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the variance is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the variance is different for each lesson interaction.
  • forgetting_penalty_terms (np.array|float) – Penalty term for the forgetting effect in the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the penalty term is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the penalty is different for each lesson interaction.
  • float, float, float, float) regularization_constant ((float,) –
    Coefficients of the regularization terms for (students, assessments,
    lessons, prereqs, concepts)
  • graph_regularization_constant (float) – Coefficient of the graph regularization term
  • student_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep participated in the assessment interaction
  • student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student participated in the assessment interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the assessment participated in the assessment interaction
  • curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the post-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the pre-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the lesson participated in the lesson interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates assessment-concept association. Concept associations for a given assessment sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • lesson_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates lesson-concept association. Concept associations for a given lesson sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • concept_participation_in_assessments (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of assessment_participation_in_concepts
  • concept_participation_in_lessons (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of lesson_participation_in_lessons
  • np.array) prereq_edge_concept_idxes ((np.array,) – (Indices of prereq concepts, Indices of postreq concepts)
  • scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) concept_participation_in_prereq_edges ((scipy.sparse.csr_matrix,) –

    The first binary matrix has dimensions [number of unique concepts] X [number of prereq edges], where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the prereq in the edge.

    The second binary matrix has the same dimensions, where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the postreq in the edge.

  • regularization_constants (np.array) – Coefficient of regularization term for each parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last student embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_lesson_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last lesson embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_prereq_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last prereq embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last student bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • num_timesteps (int) – Maximum number of timesteps in a student history, i.e., the output of InteractionHistory.duration()
  • using_bias (bool) – Including bias terms in the assessment result likelihood
  • using_graph_prior (bool) – Including the graph regularization term
  • gradient (np.array) – Placeholder for the flattened gradient
Return type:

(float, np.array)
Returns:

The value of the cost function (evaluated at the supplied parameter values), and the flattened gradient of the cost function (evaluated at the supplied parameter values)
grad.with_scipy_without_prereqs(param_vals, param_shapes, assessment_interactions, lesson_interactions, learning_update_variance, forgetting_penalty_terms, regularization_constant, graph_regularization_constant, student_participation_in_assessment_ixns, student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns, assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns, curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns, assessment_participation_in_concepts, lesson_participation_in_concepts, concept_participation_in_assessments, concept_participation_in_lessons, prereq_edge_concept_idxes, concept_participation_in_prereq_edges, regularization_constants, last_student_embedding_idx, last_assessment_embedding_idx, last_lesson_embedding_idx, last_prereq_embedding_idx, last_student_bias_idx, last_assessment_bias_idx, num_timesteps, using_bias, using_graph_prior, gradient)¶

Compute the gradient of the cost function with respect to model parameters

Parameters:
  • param_vals (np.array) – Flattened, concatenated parameter values
  • tuple] param_shapes (dict[str,) – A dictionary mapping a parameter’s name to the shape of its np.ndarray
  • np.array, np.array) assessment_interactions ((np.array,) – For each assessment interaction, (student_idx, assessment_idx, outcome), where outcome is -1 or 1
  • np.array, np.array) lesson_interactions ((np.array,) – For each lesson interaction, (student_idx, lesson_idx, time_since_previous_interaction)
  • learning_update_variance (np.array|float) – Variance of the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the variance is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the variance is different for each lesson interaction.
  • forgetting_penalty_terms (np.array|float) – Penalty term for the forgetting effect in the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the penalty term is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the penalty is different for each lesson interaction.
  • float, float, float, float) regularization_constant ((float,) –
    Coefficients of the regularization terms for (students, assessments,
    lessons, prereqs, concepts)
  • graph_regularization_constant (float) – Coefficient of the graph regularization term
  • student_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep participated in the assessment interaction
  • student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student participated in the assessment interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the assessment participated in the assessment interaction
  • curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the post-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the pre-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the lesson participated in the lesson interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates assessment-concept association. Concept associations for a given assessment sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • lesson_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates lesson-concept association. Concept associations for a given lesson sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • concept_participation_in_assessments (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of assessment_participation_in_concepts
  • concept_participation_in_lessons (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of lesson_participation_in_lessons
  • np.array) prereq_edge_concept_idxes ((np.array,) – (Indices of prereq concepts, Indices of postreq concepts)
  • scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) concept_participation_in_prereq_edges ((scipy.sparse.csr_matrix,) –

    The first binary matrix has dimensions [number of unique concepts] X [number of prereq edges], where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the prereq in the edge.

    The second binary matrix has the same dimensions, where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the postreq in the edge.

  • regularization_constants (np.array) – Coefficient of regularization term for each parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last student embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_lesson_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last lesson embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_prereq_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last prereq embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last student bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • num_timesteps (int) – Maximum number of timesteps in a student history, i.e., the output of InteractionHistory.duration()
  • using_bias (bool) – Including bias terms in the assessment result likelihood
  • using_graph_prior (bool) – Including the graph regularization term
  • gradient (np.array) – Placeholder for the flattened gradient
Return type:

(float, np.array)
Returns:

The value of the cost function (evaluated at the supplied parameter values), and the flattened gradient of the cost function (evaluated at the supplied parameter values)
grad.without_scipy_with_prereqs(assessment_interactions, lesson_interactions, learning_update_variance, forgetting_penalty_terms, regularization_constant, graph_regularization_constant, student_participation_in_assessment_ixns, student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns, assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns, curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns, assessment_participation_in_concepts, lesson_participation_in_concepts, concept_participation_in_assessments, concept_participation_in_lessons, prereq_edge_concept_idxes, concept_participation_in_prereq_edges, regularization_constants, last_student_embedding_idx, last_assessment_embedding_idx, last_lesson_embedding_idx, last_prereq_embedding_idx, last_student_bias_idx, last_assessment_bias_idx, num_timesteps, using_bias, using_graph_prior)¶

Setup a function that will compute gradients and evaluate the cost function at supplied parameter values, for a full embedding model and a parameter estimation routine that uses gradient descent for optimization

Parameters:
  • np.array, np.array) assessment_interactions ((np.array,) – For each assessment interaction, (student_idx, assessment_idx, outcome), where outcome is -1 or 1
  • np.array, np.array) lesson_interactions ((np.array,) – For each lesson interaction, (student_idx, lesson_idx, time_since_previous_interaction)
  • learning_update_variance (np.array|float) – Variance of the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the variance is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the variance is different for each lesson interaction.
  • forgetting_penalty_terms (np.array|float) – Penalty term for the forgetting effect in the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the penalty term is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the penalty is different for each lesson interaction.
  • float, float, float, float) regularization_constant ((float,) –
    Coefficients of the regularization terms for (students, assessments,
    lessons, prereqs, concepts)
  • graph_regularization_constant (float) – Coefficient of the graph regularization term
  • student_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep participated in the assessment interaction
  • student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student participated in the assessment interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the assessment participated in the assessment interaction
  • curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the post-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the pre-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the lesson participated in the lesson interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates assessment-concept association. Concept associations for a given assessment sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • lesson_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates lesson-concept association. Concept associations for a given lesson sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • concept_participation_in_assessments (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of assessment_participation_in_concepts
  • concept_participation_in_lessons (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of lesson_participation_in_lessons
  • np.array) prereq_edge_concept_idxes ((np.array,) – (Indices of prereq concepts, Indices of postreq concepts)
  • scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) concept_participation_in_prereq_edges ((scipy.sparse.csr_matrix,) –

    The first binary matrix has dimensions [number of unique concepts] X [number of prereq edges], where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the prereq in the edge.

    The second binary matrix has the same dimensions, where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the postreq in the edge.

  • regularization_constants (np.array) – Coefficient of regularization term for each parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last student embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_lesson_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last lesson embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_prereq_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last prereq embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last student bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • num_timesteps (int) – Maximum number of timesteps in a student history, i.e., the output of InteractionHistory.duration()
  • using_bias (bool) – Including bias terms in the assessment result likelihood
  • using_graph_prior (bool) – Including the graph regularization term
Return type:

function
Returns:

A function that computes gradients and evaluates the cost function at supplied parameter values. See the docstring below for my_grads for further details.
grad.without_scipy_without_lessons(assessment_interactions, lesson_interactions, learning_update_variance, forgetting_penalty_terms, regularization_constant, graph_regularization_constant, student_participation_in_assessment_ixns, student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns, assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns, curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns, assessment_participation_in_concepts, lesson_participation_in_concepts, concept_participation_in_assessments, concept_participation_in_lessons, prereq_edge_concept_idxes, concept_participation_in_prereq_edges, regularization_constants, last_student_embedding_idx, last_assessment_embedding_idx, last_lesson_embedding_idx, last_prereq_embedding_idx, last_student_bias_idx, last_assessment_bias_idx, num_timesteps, using_bias, using_graph_prior)¶

Setup a function that will compute gradients and evaluate the cost function at supplied parameter values, for an embedding model without lessons and a parameter estimation routine that uses gradient descent for optimization

Parameters:
  • np.array, np.array) assessment_interactions ((np.array,) – For each assessment interaction, (student_idx, assessment_idx, outcome), where outcome is -1 or 1
  • np.array, np.array) lesson_interactions ((np.array,) – For each lesson interaction, (student_idx, lesson_idx, time_since_previous_interaction)
  • learning_update_variance (np.array|float) – Variance of the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the variance is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the variance is different for each lesson interaction.
  • forgetting_penalty_terms (np.array|float) – Penalty term for the forgetting effect in the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the penalty term is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the penalty is different for each lesson interaction.
  • float, float, float, float) regularization_constant ((float,) –
    Coefficients of the regularization terms for (students, assessments,
    lessons, prereqs, concepts)
  • graph_regularization_constant (float) – Coefficient of the graph regularization term
  • student_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep participated in the assessment interaction
  • student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student participated in the assessment interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the assessment participated in the assessment interaction
  • curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the post-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the pre-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the lesson participated in the lesson interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates assessment-concept association. Concept associations for a given assessment sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • lesson_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates lesson-concept association. Concept associations for a given lesson sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • concept_participation_in_assessments (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of assessment_participation_in_concepts
  • concept_participation_in_lessons (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of lesson_participation_in_lessons
  • np.array) prereq_edge_concept_idxes ((np.array,) – (Indices of prereq concepts, Indices of postreq concepts)
  • scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) concept_participation_in_prereq_edges ((scipy.sparse.csr_matrix,) –

    The first binary matrix has dimensions [number of unique concepts] X [number of prereq edges], where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the prereq in the edge.

    The second binary matrix has the same dimensions, where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the postreq in the edge.

  • regularization_constants (np.array) – Coefficient of regularization term for each parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last student embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_lesson_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last lesson embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_prereq_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last prereq embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last student bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • num_timesteps (int) – Maximum number of timesteps in a student history, i.e., the output of InteractionHistory.duration()
  • using_bias (bool) – Including bias terms in the assessment result likelihood
  • using_graph_prior (bool) – Including the graph regularization term
Return type:

function
Returns:

A function that computes gradients and evaluates the cost function at supplied parameter values. See the docstring below for my_grads for further details.
grad.without_scipy_without_prereqs(assessment_interactions, lesson_interactions, learning_update_variance, forgetting_penalty_terms, regularization_constant, graph_regularization_constant, student_participation_in_assessment_ixns, student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns, assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns, curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns, lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns, assessment_participation_in_concepts, lesson_participation_in_concepts, concept_participation_in_assessments, concept_participation_in_lessons, prereq_edge_concept_idxes, concept_participation_in_prereq_edges, regularization_constants, last_student_embedding_idx, last_assessment_embedding_idx, last_lesson_embedding_idx, last_prereq_embedding_idx, last_student_bias_idx, last_assessment_bias_idx, num_timesteps, using_bias, using_graph_prior)¶

Setup a function that will compute gradients and evaluate the cost function at supplied parameter values, for an embedding model without prereqs and a parameter estimation routine that uses gradient descent for optimization

Parameters:
  • np.array, np.array) assessment_interactions ((np.array,) – For each assessment interaction, (student_idx, assessment_idx, outcome), where outcome is -1 or 1
  • np.array, np.array) lesson_interactions ((np.array,) – For each lesson interaction, (student_idx, lesson_idx, time_since_previous_interaction)
  • learning_update_variance (np.array|float) – Variance of the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the variance is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the variance is different for each lesson interaction.
  • forgetting_penalty_terms (np.array|float) – Penalty term for the forgetting effect in the Gaussian learning update. If float, then the penalty term is constant across all interactions. If np.array, then the penalty is different for each lesson interaction.
  • float, float, float, float) regularization_constant ((float,) –
    Coefficients of the regularization terms for (students, assessments,
    lessons, prereqs, concepts)
  • graph_regularization_constant (float) – Coefficient of the graph regularization term
  • student_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep participated in the assessment interaction
  • student_bias_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student participated in the assessment interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_assessment_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of assessment interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the assessment participated in the assessment interaction
  • curr_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the post-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • prev_student_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique students * number of timesteps] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the student at a specific timestep was the pre-update student state for the lesson interaction
  • lesson_participation_in_lesson_ixns (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of lesson interactions] where a non-zero entry indicates that the lesson participated in the lesson interaction
  • assessment_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique assessments] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates assessment-concept association. Concept associations for a given assessment sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • lesson_participation_in_concepts (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – A binary matrix of dimensions [number of unique lessons] X [number of unique concepts], where an entry indicates lesson-concept association. Concept associations for a given lesson sum to one, i.e., each row sums to one.
  • concept_participation_in_assessments (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of assessment_participation_in_concepts
  • concept_participation_in_lessons (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The transpose of lesson_participation_in_lessons
  • np.array) prereq_edge_concept_idxes ((np.array,) – (Indices of prereq concepts, Indices of postreq concepts)
  • scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) concept_participation_in_prereq_edges ((scipy.sparse.csr_matrix,) –

    The first binary matrix has dimensions [number of unique concepts] X [number of prereq edges], where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the prereq in the edge.

    The second binary matrix has the same dimensions, where a non-zero entry indicates that the concept is the postreq in the edge.

  • regularization_constants (np.array) – Coefficient of regularization term for each parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last student embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_lesson_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last lesson embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_prereq_embedding_idx (int) – Index of the last prereq embedding parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_student_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last student bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • last_assessment_bias_idx (int) – Index of the last assessment bias parameter in the flattened gradient
  • num_timesteps (int) – Maximum number of timesteps in a student history, i.e., the output of InteractionHistory.duration()
  • using_bias (bool) – Including bias terms in the assessment result likelihood
  • using_graph_prior (bool) – Including the graph regularization term
Return type:

function
Returns:

A function that computes gradients and evaluates the cost function at supplied parameter values. See the docstring below for my_grads for further details.
